H0.text: Pressure is what the three units of kPa, atm, or mmHg commonly measure.

H1.text: Resistance is commonly measured in units of kPa, atm, or mmHg.

H2.text: Weight is commonly measured using the three units kPa, atm, and mmHg.

H3.text: Energy is commonly measured by the three units of kpa, atm, or mmhg.

A4.text: Blood pressure is measured in millimetres (or centimetres) of mercury in most of the world.

A5.text: The standard atmosphere (atm) is defined as 101325 Pa.
